Job description

Contact Centre Sales Trainer/Coach

  • Newly created position with growth opportunity

  • Market Leading Organisation


Fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills in this blended training and quality assurance role.


DFP Recruitment have proudly partnered with a well known energy company based in the heart of Melbourne CBD. We are looking for an experienced trainer with compliance and sales experience.


The Position

  • Manage the end `to end requirements that ultimately deliver quality sales results through people within the call centre, through a tight small quality assurance team.
  • Identify and assess current and future sales training needs through job analysis, career paths, and consultation with line managers.
  • Create and deliver group and personalised training and development plans that address skill gaps, needs and expectations.
  • Own, manage and deliver the Sales and Compliance Team Induction Training programs.
  • Responsible for compliance and to implement training quality and Compliance benchmarks across all channels
  • Plan and carry out activities to maintain and develop operational efficiency of all services, in accordance with agreed strategy and KPIs and quality guidelines imposed by all parties, internal and external.

\xa0

The Candidate

\xa0

  • Experience creating and delivering sales training content
  • Training facilitation experience in a call centre environment
  • Excellent communication and rapport building skills
  • Sales management and coaching skills
  • Certificate IV in Training desirable

\xa0

The Opportunity

  • Work in a brand-new state of the art office in the heart of the CBD
  • Salary package - $100K including Bonuses and Super
  • Newly created position with growth opportunity

\xa0

If this role is suitable please apply now, alternatively please call Christie Ryan at DFP Recruitment on 03 8632 9900 for a confidential discussion.

832403482:
[

Remote Site Technical Analyst

Company Name City of Boroondara Company Location Boroondara, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 86 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time, 24 month limited tenure role
  • Join our End-User Services team supporting over 30 sites across the municipality!
  • $86,648 - $94,276 (plus Super and RDO)

At the City of Boroondara, we’re revolutionising the way we work. We’re putting the customer at the centre of everything we do, which means there are exciting changes ahead including the delivery of a brilliant new digital experience for our people and our community.

To support this transformation, we have identified a number of new and additional roles within our Information Technology team to support the newly created role of Chief Information Officer.

If you are excited by continuous improvement and creating a genuinely great customer experience, come and be part of our transformation journey!

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced and qualified Remote Site Technical Anaylst to join our team at the City of Boroondara on a full time basis for 24 months.

Your role with us

Reporting to the IT End User Services Team Leader, you will work closely with project managers, IT technical teams and various levels of the organisation to help assess requirements, identify appropriate solutions and coordinate the delivery and support of Council initiatives. You will provide technical support either remotely or in person to all Council sites and meeting rooms.

Duties include;
  • Proactively work with all Council sites and field staff to gather, document and review technology and support requirements;
  • Troubleshooting and resolving hardware and/or software faults reporting through Service Desk;
  • The role encompasses aspects of business case development and solution design, project management, support of services, collaboration, business improvement and training.

This is an opportunity to proactively build relationships with key stakeholders at our various sites. Don’t wait for a problem to occur and sit waiting for tickets to resolve; be on the front foot and anticipate pain points to provide proactive solutions!

About You

To be successful in this role you will bring experience with end-user devices, analysing business requirements and implementing network related technologies. You will have a “can-do” attitude and won’t be afraid to go out and proactively visit sites. Your Tertiary Qualifications in IT and/or a related field along with basic project management qualifications or certifications will be paramount to your success in this role.

Want to know more?

To be considered for this role, please submit your application online via our website, by close of business, Sunday 2 September 2018

Please ensure your cover letter addresses the key selection criteria found in the position description below. Previous applicants for the role of End-User Site Services Officer need not apply.

For any further information please refer to the

Council recognises the benefits of a diverse workforce for its employees and customers. To ensure equity of access to employment opportunities, Council encourages applications from underrepresented groups including people who are from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people from different ages, abilities, gender identities, sexual orientation and cultural backgrounds.

Applicants must have the right to work in Australia. The successful applicant may be required to undergo a National Criminal History check, medical check and/or working with children check.

Who are we?

The City of Boroondara is a metropolitan council, representing more than 170,000 people in the inner-eastern suburbs of Melbourne. A leader in the local government sector, with a reputation for innovation and excellence, we believe in providing an environment where our staff thrive, both in the work they do and in how they learn and develop as people and professionals.

We like to challenge the norm and we are investing significantly in innovation and technology improvements in order to provide our customers with an even greater experience and engagement. We are putting our customers at the forefront of what we do with our organisation wide change initiative, the Customer Experience Improvement Strategy (CEIS).

You will be instrumental in driving this change across the organisation using best practice approaches to successfully support us from the now to our desired future state.

With so much going on it’s a great time to join Boroondara!

Seniority Level

Entry level

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Government Administration
  • Hospital & Health Care

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

Technical Specialist ISE

Company Name Optus Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 471 views

Job description

Join a company dedicated to your career development & where you can simply be yourself at work!!

Technical Specialist- Cisco ISE

Join a company dedicated to your career development & where you can simply be yourself at work!!

About the role – Are you ready?

At Optus Business, we're passionate about providing the best IT Managed Services to our Enterprise and Government customers and we are looking for a Technical Specialist, with in-depth experience with Cisco ISE to join our team.

As our Cisco ISE Technical Specialist, you’ll provide a high level of technical leadership, support and post-sales delivery services to one key client. You will be involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting and resolving complex technical challenges relating to network, IP Telephony, security, storage and wireless solutions. This role will be predominantly focused on Cisco platforms.

What does success look like?

You’ll be an experienced Engineer, with demonstrable pedigree in Managed Services environments. We need you to be both customer focused, yet technically astute and able to provide levels of technical advice to both ‘business as usual’ (BAU) and project customer work. You will naturally be a team player and enjoy working with a flexible approach that will allow you to work closely with other Senior Engineers, Architects, Project Managers, Sales, Change Management and our customers.

Technically speaking, we’ll expect you to have experience in the following areas:
  • Demonstrable experience in Cisco Routing & Switching technology solutions
  • DemDemonstDemonstrable and in-depth experience of Cisco ISE
  • Desirable technical qualifications including Cisco Certifications – CCNA, CCNP etc
  • Experience in building, installation, deploying and supporting core network technologies together with Riverbed Optimisation and Cisco wireless solutions
  • Experience of F5 technologies


We aren’t just a Telco anymore; we are a company of innovation, we have moved to the forefront of technology and entertainment. We are a part of the digital disruption, changing the way we deliver media services and content to you; continuing to create experiences that move you.

Employee Benefits

Working at Optus will provide you with a range of benefits that will enrich your personal and professional life. With features such as a range on on-site Health and Wellbeing specialists, financial advisers, company discounts and child care services, we ensure that we provide you with a safe and productive work environment.

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives & life experiences of all our people help us innovate & create strong connections with all of our customers.

Head on over to http://www.optus.com.au/about/careers to find out more about what it's like working with Optus.

Heads Up! Due to the fast paced nature of our business, vacancy close dates may change, so make sure you apply today!

  • Internet

Territory Manager - IVD

Company Name Abacus dx Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 76 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

ABOUT THE ROLE

  • Based in Melbourne
  • Work in an exciting entrepreneurial environment offering high-quality niche products and innovative solutions
  • Manage customer relationships and build revenue within an assigned customer base across VIC/TAS.
  • In vitro\xa0diagnostic product portfolio
  • Autonomous sales field environment
  • Liaise with sales and product management team to implement sales strategies


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Achieve designated sales budget and specific product-related sales targets in assigned territory
  • Plan and implement assigned territory sales strategy in conjunction with the direct manager and product management team
  • Report regularly on revenue performance to budget and variance analysis
  • Maintain complete and accurate customer data
  • Assess sales strategies and make recommendations about changes or new initiatives to improve the business
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders and key customers in assigned territory
  • Proactive communication of customer ordering variations with respect to inventory management
  • Travel to and management of customers across different geographical locations
  • Represent the company at local and interstate conferences and customer events
  • Contribute to the organisational culture and continuous improvement of Abacus dx


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Proven experience and track record in a revenue creating role
  • A minimum of five years sales experience with\xa0in vitro\xa0diagnostic products
  • Strong knowledge of the in vitro\xa0diagnostic market in Victoria and Tasmania
  • Tertiary level qualifications in medical laboratory science or equivalent
  • Work experience in a pathology laboratory
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Ability to interpret, present and communicate technical information
  • Analytical problem solving skills
  • Interpersonal and relationship building skills
  • Time management and prioritisation of tasks
  • Ability to communicate clearly, both verbally and in writing
  • Experience in Microsoft Office products and Customer Relationship Management tools


BENEFITS & CULTURE

We are committed to providing a safe, supportive and productive workplace. We encourage open and honest communication in an environment that is free from discrimination and where all employees are treated with dignity, courtesy and respect. We pride ourselves on our values of Collaboration, Leadership, Excellence and Commitment.

Remuneration will include a highly-competitive salary and bonus structure, vehicle allowance, fuel card and 10% company-sponsored superannuation and other benefits.


ABOUT Abacus dx

Abacus dx is a leading distributor of high-quality medical diagnostic, medical education and life science products, utilised by laboratories and healthcare providers in Australia and New Zealand. Our head office is based in Brisbane with regional offices spread across Australia and New Zealand.

Abacus dx has been formed by the merger of Abacus ALS and Diagnostic Solutions.

Please submit your application letter and detailed resume to Nicole Player by email - n.player@abacusdx.com prior to 3 September 2018. Please phone 1800 222 287 for further information.
